description: From Middle English fairness, fæȝernesse, from Old English fæġernes (“fairness; beauty; pleasantness”), equivalent to fair +‎ -ness. Cognate with Old High German fagarnessi (“fairness”).

entries.meaning: The property of being fair or equitable.
examples: Some questioned the fairness of the new laws.

entries.meaning: (archaic or literary) The property of being fair or beautiful.
